clean_story:
"Computational knowledge. Answers like a superbrain. "

"Wolfram Alpha"—named after its creator, Stephen Wolfram—is a calculator on steroids.


Most search engines give you links.
Wolfram Alpha gives you direct answers, like a teacher who solves math problems and explains them.


Type "New York vs. London weather"—it shows real-time comparisons, not just web pages.
Ask "how many calories in 2 apples"—it calculates nutritional data instantly.

Even "plot x^2 + 3x - 5" generates a graph in seconds.


It doesn’t just search the web.
It computes answers using built-in data—math, science, geography, even pop culture.

Like a Swiss Army knife for facts, but smarter.


Three related subjects are symbolic computation, data visualization tools, and AI-powered search engines.
